item.title: lab members
item.description: Justin Silverman (PI) Michelle Nixon (Assistant Research Professor) Kyle McGovern (PhD Student, Bioinformatics and Genomics) Farhani Momotaz (Masters Student, Informatics)

item.title: publications
item.description: Preprints Microbiota responses to different prebiotics are conserved within individuals and associated with habitual fiber intake. bioRxiv Multiomics implicate gut microbiota in altered lipid and energy metabolism in Parkinson’s disease. medRxiv Analysis and visualization of epidemics on the timescale of burden: derivation and application of Epidemic Resistance Lines (ERLs) to COVID-19 outbreaks in the US. medRxiv Inferring Principal Components in the Simplex with Multinomial Variational Autoencoders. OpenReview 2021 Bayesian Multinomial Logistic Normal Models through Marginally Latent Matrix-T Processes.

item.title: code
item.description: fido Bayesian multinomial logistic normal models, really fast. Lots of models including linear and non-linear regression, time-series analysis, and joint modeling of multi-omic data. renamed from stray. GitHub RcppHungarian Header library and R functions to solve minimum cost bipartite matching problem using Huhn-Munkres algorithm. CRAN RcppCoDA Blazing fast library for the analysis of compositional data with both C++ and R interfaces GitHub philr Phylogenetic partitioning based ILR transform for metagenomics data.

item.title: open positions
item.description: We are currently hiring graduate students. Contact Justin Silverman if you are interested.

item.title: press
item.description: Footprints of the invisible enemy – Why a study showing that COVID-19 is everywhere is good news. (April 2020). The Economist How deadly is the coronavirus? The true fatality rate is tricky to find, but researchers are getting close. (July 2020) The Conversation New Study Suggests 8.7 million Americans had Coronavirus in March but 80% were never diagnosed. (June 22, 2020). CNN with Wolf Blitzer and Sanjay Gupta Study Identifies Abnormal Surge of Flu-like illness in March.

item.title: research
item.description: in brief We conduct cutting-edge research developing Bayesian statistical and machine learning methods for the analysis of various types of data including genomic, electronic health, and public health data. Our lab is founded on collaborations with both accademia and industry, so please contact us. long form If it has cool math and an impactful question, we are interested. Based on Dr. Silverman’s combined medical and statistical training, we tend to gravitate to problems in the analysis of biomedical data; especially, genomics and electronic health data.
